frameDefinitions: This frame is concerned with the likelihood of a Hypothetical_event occurring.

The answer to one open question, the Outcome, is dictated (partially or completely) by the answer to another open question, the Determinant, i.e. if the answer to the Determinant is known, the answer to the Outcome can be predicted.
This frame characterizes the likelihood that a Hypothetical_event will happen as a position on a scale of impossible to inevitable.
An Entity changes, either in its category membership, its situation, or in terms of the quality of an Attribute.
There exist a number of different possible Situations that may happen in the future.
frameExamples: It is <t>likely</t> that he'll arrive late.
Economic policy is partially a <t>function</t> of cultural values.
You <t>should</t> take the doses about 12 hours apart and at the same time each day.
As soon as Tiffany kissed the frog, Tiffany <t>turned</t> into a frog.
You have but two <t><fex name='Situation'>choices</fex></t> for your daughter .
listRoleDefinitions: The state of affairs or occurrence whose likelihood is assessed.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
An open question that is (to some degree) predictable from the Determinant.
An open question that determines the <fen>Outcome</fen>.
A numerical representation of the probability that a Hypothetical_event will occur.
A metaphorical representation of the position on the scale of likelihood that the Hypothetical_event will occur.
The event that is expected to happen with a certain likelihood.
The <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> that the speaker finds desirable.
The concrete or abstract entity that undergoes a change.
The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that results from the change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to before it undergoes the change.
The value of the <fen>Attribute</fen> before the change takes place.
The quality of the <fen>Attribute</fen> that results from the change.
A characteristic of the <fen>Entity</fen> for which a quality can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement, or observation.

The <fen>Initial_value</fen> and <fen>Final_value</fen> taken together as the range through which the <fen>Entity</fen> changes.

The main faith of the church has <t>changed</t> <fex name='val'>between Orthodox, Protestant and Greek Catholic</fex> several times.
The <fen>Entity</fen>'s situation that results from the change.
The situation that the <fen>Entity</fen> began in.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the transformation.
The location that the change takes place.
Something that may happen in the future, or at least whose factual status is unresolved. This is often tagged in a second role layer and generally contains the target.

An individual involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.

'<fex name='Agent'>You</fex> have a <t>choice</t>.'
An entity intimately involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Rain</fex> is fairly unlikely today, I think.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>today</fex>.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>in Seattle</fex>.
Price, in such a case, depends <fex>only on the whim of the supplier</fex>.
There's a <fex>95 %</fex> chance of rain today.
Chances are <fex>slim</fex> that he'll pull through.
He's got a small chance <fex>of making it out alive</fex>.
How pleasing to see that <fex>Martha</fex> has changed now.
The viccar changed <fex>from a professional clergyman</fex> into an anti-ecclesiastical activist.
At that time, my asthma changed <fex>from very mild</fex> to severe.
Its color changed from red <fex>to blue</fex>.
Test to check if <fex>the color</fex> changes when you place your mouse over the JavaScript image
Tests went from taking three hours <fex>to needing less than one</fex> .
She slowly shifted <fex>from giving him makework</fex> to actually finding he had some skills .
You have one choice to make <fex>for him</fex>.

about 1.4 to 5.5 degrees Celsius (2.5 to 10 degrees Fahrenheit

sourceCandidateSpans.text: 1.5 to 2.5 million square kilometers (579,000 to 965,000 square miles
as much as several hundred million
